alert.note: Alert for Crawford; Effingham; Jasper (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Central Illinois (Central and East Central Illinois)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 02 at 2:47AM CDT until August 02 at 8:45AM CDT by NWS Central Illinois
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 1145 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Illinois, including the following counties, Crawford, Effingham, Jasper and Richland. * WHEN...Until 1145 AM CDT Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 246 AM CDT, Flooding is ongoing. Between 5 and 11 inches of rain have fallen, and flooding continues in the area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Newton, Dieterich, Ste. Marie, Claremont, Wheeler, Bogota, West Liberty, Dundas, Newton Lake and Latona. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
